channel.title: Someone Explain Sprites to Me
channel.description:
I'm attempting to add a rune essence sprite into my client and I need a little help understanding something.
I added the sprite 3275.spr into my sprites.rscd file. But how do I get this picture to show up in the game?
What confuses me is how let's say a fire rune, which is 2180.spr but in ItemDef, fire rune is sprite 30.
Where does the 30 come from and how does it tie in with 2180.spr?

item.title: Someone Explain Sprites to Me
item.dc:creator: @dimebagx dimebagx
item.description:
@dimebagx wrote:

good job

Read full topic

item.title: Someone Explain Sprites to Me
item.dc:creator: @Motaro Motaro
item.description:
@Motaro wrote:

I literally just figured it out came here to delete this lol.

It’s because I renamed it 3275 which would mean according to this

public static final int SPRITE_TEXTURE_START = 3220; it would be a texture where it shouldn’t be.

Changed it to 2589.spr and it works where it’s recognized as

public static final int SPRITE_ITEM_START = 2150; , an inventory item.

Read full topic

item.title: Someone Explain Sprites to Me
item.dc:creator: @dimebagx dimebagx
item.description:
@dimebagx wrote:

30 is the ItemID of the fire rune,
where you’d use

::item 30 500 ect.

2180 is the inventory image, it does not have sprites

Read full topic
